description: Just it had a animation when starting new game it would become perfect. Thanks to the developers.
summary: It is good on it's own

description: Well if you are a GNOME user and into Minesweeping, It is not going to get any better than this... Another example of a finely crafted GNOME Game

At first you think it's great. But if you don't rely purely on luck you pretty soon realize that more often than not the maps don't allow for a solution by skill/calculation. Most of the time you have to pick a random spot and hope (!) that there is not a mine because the map is so poorly generated that you can't calculate where the safe spots are.

So: If you are bored and don't want to think and just tap on stuff, go for it, the UI is great and you're gonna have some fun. If you're like me on the other hand and think about minesweeper as a puzzle and want to solve it, this is not the generator you want to use.
Does exactly what you expect.
If you want to play Minesweeper on Linux, this is an amazing game.
summary: Great game. Best mines for Linux

description: this game is like a puzzle.

Nice interface, highscores, different difficulties, custom boards.

Has everything I can imagine for a great Minesweeper game.

The app works great on my Ubuntu 18.04 running in Virtual Box using a Windows 10 Home edition host.

I only wish that it could be 100% playable using the keyboard. I could not find an equivalent to right-click for setting FLAG or FLAG with Question Mark.

Great work!
summary: Love sharing this game with my son

description:
This review was written based on v3.28.0 played on KDE.

Summary: A good clone of Windows Minesweeper, though with some differences. A couple of minor bugs/weaknesses prevent a 5-star rating, but there is nothing drastically bad that will inhibit enjoyment of this game.

----------------

This is a clone of Windows Minesweeper, though there are some. For the most part, it is similar though. The gameplay is the same: try to safely clear non-mine squares using the clues of how many mines are next to uncovered squares.

Unlike older versions of Windows Minesweeper, the custom levels are not generated with an exact number of mines. Another difference is that this version appears to track high scores even for custom levels. So you can challenge your friends to beat your 1 second high score on the 30x50 minefield containing only 1% mines. ;)

In Windows Minesweeper, simultaneously clicking the left+right mouse buttons on a square would attempt to automatically clear the surrounding squares if the square's number of mines were flagged. For example, suppose there was a square with a "2" and there were 2 flagged squares next to it. Clicking the left+right mouse buttons on the square with the "2" would uncover the remaining non-flagged squares around the "2". In this version of Mines, the same functionality is accomplished by simply left clicking, which is more convenient. Another difference is that Windows Mines would depress all of the unknown squares surrounding a square when the left+right mouse buttons were clicked. That trick was useful in seeing the remaining available unknown squares at times, but this version does not appear to have a comparable feature.

There are three display settings, one of which looks similar to Windows Minesweeper (though the 7 and 8 squares are yellow and white as opposed to black and grey, respectively).

There is a "Help" menu item in this version, but clicking on it does not appear to do anything. Though this game is probably considered to be in the realm of common knowledge in the early 21st century, any first-time users might be at a loss as to how the game works without help. Even veteran users might have benefited from a help page explaining some of the different options, such as "Show Warnings".

Some nitpicky things I did not like about this version:
1.) If you clear the field but do not get a high score, the game takes you back to the "home" page immediately. You do not get a chance to see what your time was.
2.) The window is not resizeable and the minefield scales to fit the available window space. In other words, the 8x8 board fills a large part of the screen. The scale is not consistent with the 16x16 or 30x16 fields.
3.) The game tracks high scores, but there is no convenient way to reset the high score list.
When checking fields with mines using right click, the flags do not appear.
Can somebody explain to me why this is cluttering up an otherwise outstanding system?

Why is this included as a standard component of Ubuntu?
Surely every user can choose to install software from the main system.
It's a schlepp to have to uninstall all these unwanted packages
why this was installed?
It is 100% playable by keyboard. In order to flag a mine just press Ctrl+space/ Ctrl+space+space.
the "there is a mine here" flag doesn't appear

The mine flag does not appear when selected. It does appear to be active, and will cycle through other flag options.

Using Zorin OS.
Beautifully designed UI, good customizability
great game
Colours impossible to play with
The installation will set the resolution back to the tiny resolution, but it is fun and playable.

Both this latest version and the previous one on 18.04 keep crashing for no apparent reason. I only uograded to 20.04 so I could play minesweeper to the end. Latest version crashes even more. Hopeless
Kann alles was man von diesem Klassiker erwartet.

Das Standarttheme sowie die verfügbaren Themes sind sehr blass und farblos. Dadurch ist die Orientierung im Spiel erschwert. Zudem halten micro-Animationen das Spiel unnötig auf. Es geht hier schließlich um Geschwindigkeit!
Eine gute Alternative Bietet kmines.
Farbschema könnte in der Tat eindeutiger sein. Im Speziellen zwischen nicht aufgedeckten und aufgedeckten Feldern kann man nur schlecht unterscheiden.
Das spiel ist einfach aufgebaut schnell verstanden aber denn och schwer beim spielen.

Einfach nur unfair... Irgendwelche Zahlen und Landminen was soll das?
Ich halte es für sehr geschmacklos sich über Landminen und deren Todesopfer lustig zu machen.

Irhendwelche zahlen und Minen?

Es handelt sich hier um einen aktiongeladenen Spieleklassiker,
der die welt schon seit Jahrzehnten begleitet.
Schon vorgehende Generationen schätzten diese Art der Unterhaltung sehr. (Quelle n24)

Es ist immer wieder faszinierend wie einfach und komplex solch eine Art des Zeitvertreibs sein kann.
Aber das ganze hat doch seinen Ursprung 480 v. Chr. in der Schlacht von Salamis. Diese Schlacht war eine der bedeutendsten Seeschlachten im Mittelmeerraum in der Antike. Sie wird von einigen Historikern wie Christian Meier, neben der Schlacht von Marathon, als dasjenige Zentralereignis in der abendländischen Geschichte gewertet, das mithalf, die Zivilisationsgeschichte Europas eigenständig gegen die des Ostens zu behaupten.
Ich finde die Ähnlichkeit dieses Ereignisses zu diesem Spiel sehr beeindrucken. Denn auch hier Will man sich gegen ein logarithmischen Algorithmus behaupten und siegen.
Deshalb klare Empfehlung.

Ps: gassnero ich kann deine Ansicht überhaupt nicht nachvollziehen.
Wo ist das Problem sich Über Landminen lustig zu machen.
Stell dir mal vor eine kleine Pummelige Landmine mit Augenklappe und Holzbein.
Oder eine Landmine mit die du jeden Tag füttern musst wie Pooo weil sie sonst explodiert.
Sieh nicht immer alles so kritisch an und leg dir mal ne Packung Humor zu ;)
Doeses Spiel macht mega Spaß und ist ein 100%iges Strategiespiel.
einfach nur dumm
Me gusta como se ve y que podes personalizarlo un poco.
Muy bonita. bastante recomendable para hacer de la espera un buen momento. Excelente
lo que trae un buscaminas ni mas ni menos
interface simple et efficace
il manque juste la consultation des meilleurs scores
La logique ne suffit pas pour résoudre le puzzle. Il y a des situations où l'on se retrouve devant deux possibilités. Une chance sur deux de choisir la bonne configuration.
Всё-таки, думается "в цвете"  игра была бы привлекательней. Серое поле навевает уныние и тоску.
Отлично убивает свободное время
Игра с отличным сюжетом.Жаль,что быстро заканчивается...

很棒啊 界面和动画帧都挺不错的
很好，很经典的小游戏，希望能一直做下去
界面很清爽，手感很好，偶尔玩一玩很棒。
